intro: Phyteuma orbiculare var. cordatum, commonly known as the heart-shaped phyteuma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It features lanceolate to ovate leaves that are often heart-shaped, giving it its botanical variant name. The plant produces tall, sturdy stems with clusters of bell-shaped, tubular flowers in shades of yellow to orange. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its blooming period typically occurs in late spring to early summer.
